title: Lena Dunham talks about being 18 months sober after receiving Friendly House's Women Of Year award
text:
She has been sober for 18 months.

And Lena Dunham talked about how she achieved that after coming off the anti-anxiety medication Klonopin.

The Girls creator, 33, spoke to People about her recovery at the Friendly House treatment center’s 30th Awards Luncheon at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills on Saturday.

Bright and beautiful: Lena Dunham lat the Friendly House treatment center’s 30th Awards Luncheon at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills on Saturday

The writer-actress was given the Women Of The Year award by Demi Moore, 56, who herself has battled addiction. The event was hosted by actress and singer Katey Sagal, 65, who has been sober for three decades.

Looking good in a bright green silky top and white pants with pale blue flowers, Lena looked back on how she got sober as she stood on the podium.

'I’m here because getting sober changed my life and I’m really, really passionate about recovery and sober living being available for everyone no matter their income bracket, especially for women who are so often put in danger when they are new to sobriety,' Lena revealed.

'I think that for me, Friendly House is just representative of what America can do if we make the choice to support recovery.'

Great from all angles: Lena looked lovely in a green silky top, white pants with pale blue flowers and orange sandals at the awards

And she recalled the moment when her parents dropped her off at the threshold of the treatment center 'like it was camp.

'I took off my boots,' she continued. 'There was a no shoes rule, and walked into a room of people whose pain radiated off of them, like some terrible superpower.

'I was such an open nerve that on my first day of group therapy when I was asked to share a little bit about why I was there, I told my seemingly endless tale of, whoa, you know, the one that justified and necessitated being numbed by medication.

'The patients and the therapist simply looked at me and said, "shit." ’

An honor; The writer-actress was given the Women Of The Year award by Demi Moore, 56, at the event, hosted by actress and singer Katey Sagal, 65, who has been sober for three decades

Cuddling up: Demi, looking beautiful in a blue jumpsuit, has also battled with addiction

Lena added: 'I love Friendly House because they are trans and non-binary inclusive, because they don’t turn women away because of income bracket, because they bring women together who are from really different paths of life and allow them to connect through the miracle of recovery.'

She insisted she began to heal 'because I allowed myself to be loved by a group of people in recovery who showed me that I was worth saving and worth loving no matter what metaphorical and, like, sometimes literal alleys I had wandered down.'

Despite that Lena said she felt 'shame' when she eventually left rehab but she's learned that her recovery 'doesn’t cancel out' who she was.

'I realized being me has hurt and sometimes it’s hurt so much that I couldn’t bear it. But being me is also a super power. And it’s the same for all of you.'

At the podium: The Girls creator and star recalled the moment when her parents dropped her off at the threshold of the treatment center 'like it was camp'
description: The 33-year-old writer-actress spoke about her addiction at the the Friendly House treatment center's 30th Awards Luncheon at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills on Saturday.
